CJ Robinson
Data person. Thanks for visiting!

My full name is Christopher, but mostly I go by CJ.

I work at The New York Times as a senior data analyst for the Games team. We use user engagement data to understand what can make NYT Games like Wordle, Strands, Connections, and the Crossword more engaging and enjoyable.

I enjoy transit, cities, coffee, and games.

A few things I’ve done and places I’ve worked:

  • data scientist at Expedia working on geotesting and mobile marketing
  • research intern at the Brookings Institution visualizing income inequality and tax burdens
  • undergrad fellow with Data Science for Social Good at the University of Washington researching a form of congestion pricing in Washington State – full report here!.
  • research assistant at the Social Policy and Research Lab at the University of Washington examining employment discrimination and implicit bias
  • intern at the Seattle City Council creating a database of local businesses, helping form speaking points, and answering phones
